content:
:::warning[Important]
The following instructions and screen captures were valid as of December, 2022. For further help, check your Okta documentation.
:::

metadata.title: Obtaining your Okta URL domain and API token

content:
### Procedure {#procedure} 1. Sign in to your Okta organization. 2. Click **Admin** to open the **Admin Console**. 3. Find your Okta URL domain. 1. In the upper-right corner of the Okta admin console, click on your user name. A panel with your user name and Okta domain appears. 4. Create an API token. :::warning[Important] - Ensure your account has any of the following roles assigned before creating an API token.

Feature

User roles allowed

Data upload

metadata.title: Obtaining your Okta URL domain and API token
metadata.heading: Procedure {#procedure}

content:
• Super admin

  • Org admin

  • API access management admin

  • Mobile admin

  • Read-only admin

  • App admin

User enforcement

  • Super admin

  • Org admin

  • Group admin

- API tokens have the same permissions as the user who creates them. If the user permissions change, the API token permissions also change. ::: 1. In the Okta admin console, go to **Security → API → Tokens**. 2. Click **Create Token**. 3. Specify a name for the token and click **Create Token**. 4. Copy the token value.

metadata.title: Obtaining your Okta URL domain and API token
metadata.heading: Procedure {#procedure}

content: :::warning[Important] Once you close the **Create token** dialog, the authentication token is no longer available to view or copy. :::
